metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13134 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: In ImageMagick 7.0.6-6 and GraphicsMagick 1.3.26, a heap-based buffer over-read was found in the function SFWScan in coders/sfw.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0292-CVE-2017-13134-Fix-heap-based-buffer-overflow-in-SFWScan.patch in wheezy 0249-CVE-2017-13134.patch in jessie 0100-CVE-2017-13134.patch in stretch

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-19').
imagemagick package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.9.7.4+dfsg-16ubuntu8').
